book.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows (Harry Potter, #7)

review.body: I love Harry Potter!

Awwwww

True love preserves through it all.. I was so into this book that I read it in about two hours.. The plot had so many twists and turns and the characters were awesome.. Everyone of them was interconnected some kind of way.. Great standalone book!!!!
Ok
DNF. Narration was crap..

Exciting new spinoff from Grim

I loved this book! M.K. Eidem has branched out to introduce another culture connected to the Tornians. I love how she has interwoven the characters from her other books with this one. I can't wait for the next story. Definitely a keeper! I highly recommend this book...

book.title: Prophet and Serenity: A Brooklyn Love

review.body:
A good read

Where is part II! This book is the ish. I I've all the characters in this book. I can't wait to see what happens next.
Loved it! The characters are so well written and thought out. From the first page you feel like part of the story and never want it to end. The whole series is great and this book is no exception.
A horrid little book. I refuse to finish.
It just ended, and it was sad.

Having played the PS4 game first, I was already hooked. I couldn't leave this universe so soon and wow, I am glad I started reading the books. For me, I actually think it's better that I played the last game in the series before going right back to the first book. Somehow it just makes every stor...
Okay, not as good as the first 3.

book.title: A Home To Die For (A Tanner Novel Book 14)

review.body:
A another success by Mr. Kane

I continually find myself waiting for the next book in the series. What more can I say other than I enjoy Mr. Kane's writing and highly recommend this book.
Awesome!
Total guilty pleasure. America is an idiot.
Awesome!
A disturbing book with an annoying moral dilemma. The protagonist narrator is obviously very ill.... and so is his 'loving' family.
Quick read. Not my favorite. Didn't really care about the characters.

"And now, the news where you are." So begins the regional news anywhere you go in the UK apart probably from London. And so introduces our main character here, Frank Allcroft, depressingly funny man - you know the kind, tweed jacket, touchy feely (in other words has no sense of boundaries) and th...

Love This Series

I love this series. Don't know how I missed that the last book came out. The Baby is the perfect ending. The writing remains fantastic and the story is fantastic. I'm just sad that this is the end of Sophie and Neil's story. Hopefully we get more of them in the future. Just be rea...

book.title: The Treasure at Poldarrow Point (Angela Marchmont Mystery #3)

review.body: Really good series by a contemporary of Agatha Christie! Angela Marchmont is first class.
